job_tasks.phrase: Define success metrics for our models
job_tasks.justification: Defining success metrics for models falls under the broader umbrella of data management and evaluation, which is crucial for understanding model performance and guiding development.

job_tasks.phrase: Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly refers to the core task of developing and evaluating machine learning models, including both traditional forecasting models and modern LLMs.

job_tasks.phrase: Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
job_tasks.justification: Building internal tooling implies software development to support the customization and deployment of models, fitting into the integration aspect of software engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
job_tasks.justification: Building infrastructure for monitoring model performance and taking action is a key aspect of MLOps, ensuring models function correctly in production.

job_tasks.phrase: Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team
job_tasks.justification: This refers to the foundational work of creating and managing the data pipelines and infrastructure necessary for ML models.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
job_tasks.justification: This describes collaboration with other technical and non-technical teams to define and build product features, which is a core software development and integration task.

job_tasks.phrase: explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
job_tasks.justification: Exploring and integrating new technologies to improve existing systems and processes is a fundamental software engineering responsibility.

soft_skills.phrase: Our customers need to understand what happened across their bank accounts in the past as well as how balances evolve in the future.
soft_skills.justification: This phrase describes the business problem the models are intended to solve, indicating a need for business understanding.

soft_skills.phrase: Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
soft_skills.justification: While a task, the mention of LLM models also implies a need for understanding and working with these specific AI technologies.

soft_skills.phrase: Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
soft_skills.justification: Building tooling requires understanding customer needs and translating them into functional software.

soft_skills.phrase: Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
soft_skills.justification: Acting on monitoring data implies a problem-solving approach to maintain model performance.

soft_skills.phrase: Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team
soft_skills.justification: Collaborating with an engineering team to build infrastructure requires effective communication and teamwork.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
soft_skills.justification: This directly mentions collaboration with various teams and the need to communicate effectively to guide product development.

soft_skills.phrase: We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there's more to come!
soft_skills.justification: This indicates a need for continuous learning and adaptability to new technologies.

soft_skills.phrase: speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things
soft_skills.justification: This implies a critical thinking and problem-solving approach to ensure the team is on the right track.

soft_skills.phrase: You'll join as the first Data hire with a broad mandate
soft_skills.justification: Being the first hire in a specific domain suggests a need for ownership and initiative.

profile.rationale: The role requires a balanced mix of core software engineering tasks (building tooling, infrastructure, data infrastructure, collaboration) and AI specialization tasks. Specifically, it involves creating and evaluating both forecasting and LLM models, indicating a focus on generative AI alongside traditional ML. The mandate to define metrics, build infrastructure for monitoring, and explore new technologies further solidifies this as a Core GenAI Engineer role.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is quite clear about the responsibilities and technologies. It explicitly mentions both forecasting and LLM models, which is a strong indicator. The tasks are well-defined, allowing for good mapping to the coding book categories. The only reason it's not a 5 is the slight ambiguity in the 'broad mandate' which could encompass more traditional ML, but the explicit mention of LLMs tips the scale towards GenAI.
